text: Alf Sadler (1906-1975) was an Australian rugby league footballer who played in the 1930s. Lower grade Five-Eighth/ Halfback, Sadler replaced the injured Jim Flower for the St. George in the 1930 Final and Grand FinalREFEREE(Sydney) 8/10/1930 "Grand Final" https://trove.nla.gov.au/newspaper/article/131169751?searchTerm=%22sadler%22%20%22st.george%22&searchLimits;=l-state=New+South+Wales|||l-decade=193|||l-year=1930|||l-month=10 The Sun (Sydney) Grand Final Teams list 1930 https://trove.nla.gov.au/newspaper/article/224237598?searchTerm=%22sadler%22%20%22st.george%22&searchLimits;=l-state=New+South+Wales|||l-decade=193|||l-year=1930|||l-month=10. Alan Whiticker/Glen Hudson: Encyclopedia of Rugby League Players, 1995. Sadler played three first grade games during his career, his debut was against Western Suburbs in Round 4 on 17th May 1930. In a strange coincidance, his only three first grade games were all against Wests (round 4, the Final and the Grand Final). Rugby League Project - Summary https://www.rugbyleagueproject.org/players/a-saddler/summary.html Sadler died on 5 July 1975 at Arncliffe, New South Wales.Sydney Morning Herald - Death Notice 7/7/1975 ==Reference== Category:St. George Dragons players Category:Rugby league players from Sydney Category:Rugby league halfbacks Category:Australian rugby league players Category:1906 births Category:1975 deaths
title: Alf Sadler
